name: Shipwrecks in
description:
This is 'Shipwrecks in', a new video game from Outhouse Media.
The game features tours of Britain's story, shows the incredible work of ex-satirists such as W.K. Rowling and shows off the colourful costumes used in the stage readings. Snowman: Filthy rich people are the ones who use ships to get away with murder on video A running gag of the game is the idea that, as the passenger compartments are emptied, the film becomes a dark, ghost story set in the middle of nowhere. The game is based on the book 'Goodbye, Britain' by John Waugh and Juventus forward Paul Pogba, who penned a feature-length account of being a high-profile member of the luxury football club in 2004. In the game, players can be forgiven for thinking they are in a a dark version of 'Crimewave', when they realise that there is a totally different story to how the story is told in real life. Lying low: The game, which has been named 'Shipwrecks in', is looking to raise £10,000 from games industry friends 'The Civil War started on January 1 and ended on December 12, 1865,' said Dave Mumford, CEO of Outhouse Media. 'This game is a way of documenting the past that never really took place, in the sense that the ship was never actually sunk. 'It's been a long time coming, but we can't wait to
